column4: whats the better way of installing ubuntu on a usb from a live CD? from system>administration>create usb startup disk OR from http://ppa.launchpad.net/probono/ubuntu/pool/main/l/liveusb/ ?and whats the difference here??
i used a utility called  unetbootin
linux doesn't use drive letter, i uses device nodes and mount point
i know how to fix that
in a terminal, go into your home directory. then type in   mv .mozilla .mozilla-restart
Not only did the problem did not go away, all my extension have dissappeared, chatzilla, download helper etc etc all :-(
ok... close out Firefox. in your home directory type in the following....  rm -r .mozilla   ...then   mv .mozilla-restart .mozilla
that will get you your stuff back but it means i don't know how to solve the original problem
okay thats done. should i restart ff now?
momentary corrupted graphics at startup of firefox are there, the message bar 'restart required' is still there too.
as i said.. it would get you your stuff back, but i do not know how to solve the original problem
ok, that's good. you will have to find someone else that hopefully know how to fix your 'restart required' problem. sorry
